body:
### Problem

With certain settings triggering autocompletion freezes nvim.

### Steps to reproduce

```
lua vim.lsp.enable({'pyright'})
set ac
set complete=o,.,w,b,u,t
set completeopt=noselect
```

Then open a python file and try typing anything. I don't think it's a problem with ruff specifically, because it once happened (I think; not 100% sure) with clangd as well.

### Expected behavior

No UI freezes.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-a9a4c27

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not tested

### Operating system/version

Linux 6.15.9-arch1-1 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Terminal name/version

st 0.9

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

aur

I managed to get a backtrace to the place where the hangup happens:

```

#3  0x0000555555aacd13 in uv.io_poll ()
#4  0x0000555555a98367 in uv_run ()
#5  0x000055555570a082 in loop_uv_run (loop=0x555555c50e40 <main_loop>, ms=-1)
    at /home/honza/dev/neovim/src/nvim/event/loop.c:61
#6  0x000055555570a0de in loop_poll_events (loop=0x555555c50e40 <main_loop>, ms=-1)
    at /home/honza/dev/neovim/src/nvim/event/loop.c:82
#7  0x000055555595fa53 in ui_client_run (remote_ui=false) at /home/honza/dev/neovim/src/nvim/ui_client.c:180
#8  0x00005555557ca646 in main (argc=2, argv=0x7fffffffdc48) at /home/honza/dev/neovim/src/nvim/main.c:348
```
Cannot reproduce. The steps to reproduce don't even use LSP omnifunc.

But with slightly modified steps I can trigger a heap-buffer-overflow:

```
==30967==ABORTING
```
```vim
set filetype=python
lua vim.lsp.enable({'pyright'})
set omnifunc=v:lua.vim.lsp.omnifunc
set ac
set complete=o,.,w,b,u,t
set completeopt=noselect
```
Still doesn't freeze without ASAN though.

> The steps to reproduce don't even use LSP omnifunc.

But doesn't Nvim auto set omnifunc to LSP one if an LSP with completion support is attached?
Yes, but the steps to reproduce do not configure any LSP server.

`'autocomplete'` is not needed to reproduce this issue, as the same happens when triggering the completion manually with Ctrl-N. I think the same thing as https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/34416#issuecomment-2964701741 is happening here, but the `noselect` additionally causes a hang. Since tagfunc overriding the completion is unexpected, it's not clear how to deal with this. I'd recommend not combining `o` with `t` in `'complete'` when using both LSP omnifunc and LSP tagfunc.

title: `complete^=o` with LSP omnifunc freezes nvim
